Reviews.Title: Don't listen to the other people
Reviews.Author: nigguhhigguh
Reviews.Content: This laptop is perfect, it handles everything without any problems. there is no back-lit keyboard on this model(j020us), but if that's what you need then i don't recommend it. the screen size is perfect for watching movies/videos. Windows 8 is honestly not even as bad as people make it seem. it took me about 20 minutes to figure out everything. the only bad thing is the 5400rpm hdd, which isnt a super big deal. the laptop boots pretty quick and the battery life isn't terrible, but what do you expect out of a 17.3-inch screen with 1600x900 pixels and a beast processor. the sound on this laptop is pretty good the beats audio is alright, you can definitely hear the base. there is bluetooth on this model. its build quality is pretty nice it doesn't feel super cheap but its nowhere near Apple quality. it doesn't seem to run too hot it stays around 40-50 degrees when running most applications which is decent. browsing the web it gets around mid 30s to low 40s. I bought a 2 year warranty from Square Trade and its way better than paying for an HP warranty, so for people complaining its pointless never buy a warranty from the company that makes the product as they will take their sweet time. Overall this is a pretty good laptop that will handle just about any application you throw at it. I wouldn't recommend it for gaming as the GPU is pretty weak, so if you're a gamer on a budget I'd recommend the Lenovo y410p which has been on sale for quite some time and the specs are more gamer oriented, but it will take them forever to ship it.

Reviews.Title: Nightmare upgrading to Windows 8.1
Reviews.Author: IndyRon
Reviews.Content: Two error messages appeared on logon after upgrading to Windows 8.1. I spent 3 hours with Microsoft tech support and another 2 hours with HP tech support trying to get rid of them. Imagine trying to understand people with heavy Indian accents on a phone line over which you can barely hear them, let alone understand them. When they took control over the computer it was a relief.We had used a Logitech mouse before upgrading and one error was related to the loading of an unfound, unneeded Logitech driver. The other error involved the driver for the accelerometer that parks the heads on the hard drive before a dropped notebook hits the floor. Microsoft tech support eventually disabled both.Wanting to keep the protection of the accelerometer, I contact HP. (AccelerometerSt.exe is HP software.) The HP tech spent two hours trying to upgrade the HP 3D DriveGuard Software with a version not meant for this model. He also suggested it was a Microsoft problem and that I get back in contact with Microsoft.Then I logged a tech support case for the issue. This morning they closed the case with the message: "Support Case Manager is not available at this time for HP ENVY 17-j020us Quad Edition Notebook PC" and suggested I go to [...]At customercare I initiated a chat session with a tech support who shortly admitted that a Windows 8.1 version of HP 3D DriveGuard was not yet available for this model and that I should check back in a month. It may not be the answer I wanted, but it was a straight answer that didn't waste my time.I'd recommend that buyers not upgrade to 8.1 for at least a month.

Reviews.Title: Good Laptop Computer
Reviews.Author: Upstate Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a really powerful computer.  It's fast, has a  lot of ram, a lot of hard drive.  Keypad seems awfully sensitive.  While I'm doing wordprocessing the cursor has a tendency to bounce, from line to line, paragraph to paragraph, page to page.  Hate Windows 8.  Wish Microsoft had evolved Windows 7, rather than have done such a complete redo.  For my purposes, Windows 8 actually permits me to do less, rather  than more.

Reviews.Title: Ok but network jack a little tricky
Reviews.Author: Ron Bushe
Reviews.Content: We've had this notebook just a couple weeks. Setup was easy. It boots up fast, but login is disappointingly slow. It came with Windows 8 and the upgrade to 8.1 is now available for free. We haven't done the upgrade yet, but plan to do so. We understand there is an option in 8.1 to boot to the desktop and a start menu, which will resolve most of the issues we have with Windows 8.Like another reviewer remarked, the edge of the notebook is tapered and isn't as thick as a network (RJ-45) jack. I don't find it an issue when plugging a network cable in, but it can be darn near impossible to get it out. Good thing the WiFi works great.HP's touchpad is very "touchy", plus the buttons are integrated into the pad. We are using a mouse with it.The size of the screen is great - until you take it on the road. It's nearly impossible to use on a plane. It's heavy, although not nearly as heavy as another HP 17.3" we have that has the bigger, longer-life battery. We call that one the "aircraft carrier".

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Fast but great battery life for day-to-day tasks. Only gripe is the slow 5400x HDD, but I understand what I was getting from the start, so I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Francis
Reviews.Content: This item came quickly, set up quickly, and I was using it right away.  Windows 8 was a little confusing at first, but that would be the only (small) complaint.

Reviews.Title: Met expectations, good value for the money.
Reviews.Author: raconter
Reviews.Content: Seems to work well enough..some setup issues, and on line support didn't seem to be very knowledgeable about the product.  Works well now, though.

Reviews.Title: Put an ethernet cable in the cart now....
Reviews.Author: Anton Ridgway
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours trying to get the laptop to go on the internet via our wifi signal.  After a week of downloading updates with a ethernet cable and a lot of troubleshooting, we were finally able to make it work.  Very satisfactory machine, but be warned that it will need some updates when you unpack it, so have an ethernet cable handy.

Reviews.Title: Poor performance,service and quality
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: This product has been a nightmare.  Certain programs wouldn't run with others, HP Customer Service was totally useless, and the machine is slower than the 4 year old HP I replaced.  Amazon was partially helpful, but never followed up on their e mail promising to follow up.  The only helpful person in this chain was the company that actually shipped the computer.  A person answered the phone on the first ring and actually talked me through several of the problems.  Kudos to them.Under no circumstances would I recommend this product to anyone, nor after experiencing HP Customer Service, will I probably purchase another HP product.Bad product, bad service! Very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: HP Computer with all the bells and whistles.
Reviews.Author: Rita P. Hestand "romance and children's author"
Reviews.Content: I used this computer for some time then gave it to my granddaughter who is going to be a teacher. I figured she really needed a good one. It has withstood her rough treatment, and is working fine. I love the fact that it can diagnose some of the problems and fix them too. Great product.

Reviews.Title: this is a good laptop.
Reviews.Author: LIU Yuan
Reviews.Content: Envy 17 runs very smoothly and silentily, it fulfill everything i wanted in my daily use. only one thing to be mentioned ,the usb ports are located so close to the mouse pad which one usually use, and it 's such a foolish design.

Reviews.Title: Best PC ever
Reviews.Author: Duke of Windsor
Reviews.Content: Very well performing Powerhouse! Very fast and smoothly operating and very great designed! It is one of the best and best looking Computers out there!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: WoodWorker "Willym47"
Reviews.Content: This is third HP laptop that I have owned and they just keep getting bigger and better. This high end machine is everything they say it is and more. Has plenty of inputs and out puts, great sound and even a finger print reader to memorize your finger print and us it as your login and password. Now how smart is that?!I upgraded to Windows 8.1 and it runs without a hitch. If you live in the apps world, then you should have no problem with this operating system. My machine is on sometimes 24/7 and I've never noticed that it gets hot. It runs cool as a cucumber! I'd recommend this machine to anyone looking for quality, power, storage and the HP reputation for customer service.

Reviews.Title: great hardware windows 8 is a bad joke
Reviews.Author: Carlos M. Vazquez
Reviews.Content: the hardware is top of the line but windows 8 is a joke I thought it couldn't be as bad as people say but it is worse HP needs to put out an android version of this laptop. will be the last Microsoft product I will ever buy all my friends say the same we just don't know if the next will be Linux or android I needed a laptop not a want to be Xbox. people don't have money to through away on Microsoft mistakes anymore.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Fred J Baltus
Reviews.Content: After I learned how to use Windows 8,this HP notebook has blown me away. It is so much faster than my other HP notebook with double the ram memory and double the hard drive that I don't wait on anything. The display is unbelievably.

Reviews.Title: HP doesn't honor their warranty on computers
Reviews.Author: John P. Hoven
Reviews.Content: I have an HP Envy dv7.  After it actually began smoking and then powered off (and has not powered on again), it took 5 HP support staff and 3 days of conversations before they agreed that it was even broken.  It has now been over 3 weeks when they told me they would have my laptop back to me in 5 business days, and now they are saying it will be at least 4 more weeks until they can return the laptop.  Dell and newegg have very good return policies and support services go to [...] or [...]if you are looking for a laptop.

Reviews.Title: HP ENVY 17-j020us Quad Edition Notebook PC
Reviews.Author: Susan Asciutto
Reviews.Content: I recieved my computer in a few days after i ordered it i was excited to open it. when i first started it up i was confused.I thought i oredered this computer with a Touch screen . i am a little turned off with not having the touch screen on it.I am not really satisfied with it but i guess i'll live with it.

Reviews.Title: No support for Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: HP has purposely designed this to NOT support Windows 7 and Windows 8 is unusable. After resetting the BIOS for Legacy support I installed Windows 7 Ultimate after which NOTHING with respect to I/O works. Not the USB, Ethernet, or DVD drive so there is no way to get the Windows 7 drivers installed. The case edge design is purely for ascetic purposes to make the customer think the laptop is thinner than it actually is. This means that plugging in the Ethernet cable requires two hands. The edge is thinner than an RJ45 jack so HP designed in a flap door that you open with one hand, and using the other hand insert the cable. The DVD drive also suffers from this edge design. The tray closes clumsily and feels like it may break at any time. If I can't find a way to get Windows 7 installed, this is going back for a refund. The Apple Mac laptop supports Windows 7 so I guess I'll be buying a MAC instead. Windows 8 is unusable. Whomever at MS came up with this design should be fired. The login in screen looks like something from a 1990's PC running DOS 3.2 (see uploaded screenshot). Shame on you HP and MS!

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core™ i7-4700MQ with Intel HD Graphics 4400 (2.4GHz, 6 MB cache)
8 GB DDR3, 1024 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive, Beats Audio
Windows 8, 17.3-Inch Screen, Intel HD graphics 4600, SuperMulti DVD burner
802.11b/g/n, Bluetooth, Intel Smart Connect Technology support, WiDi
HP TrueVision HD Webcam with integrated dual array digital microphone
ProductInfo.Name: HP ENVY 17-j020us Quad Edition Notebook PC
